title: FC Spartak-MZhK Ryazan
text:
FC Spartak-MZhK Ryazan () was a Russian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Ryazan">Ryazan</a>.
The club founded in 2004 was sponsored by "Mervinsky dwelling concern" ("Мервинский жилищный концерн", abbr. МЖК). In 2004 season the team played in <a href="Amateur%20Football%20League">Amateur Football League</a>, winning zone "Golden Ring" championship and cup. In 2005 season it played in <a href="Russian%20Second%20Division">Second Division</a> finishing at 6th place in zone Center. In 2006 season it won zone Center of Second Division and was promoted to <a href="Russian%20First%20Division">First Division</a>. In 2007 season it played only half of tournament and was at last place after playing a half, then it withdrew from tournament because of financial reasons and was dissolved.
The president of the club was Evgeniy Malyutin.
